data.title: Dell NativeEdge Blueprint Developer's Guide
data.meta_description: This guide explains to advanced developers how to write a NativeEdge Blueprint.
data.text:
Use blueprint labels to tag the blueprint itself. Blueprint labels are distinct from labels, which tag the deployments created from a blueprint.

Schema

blueprint_labels labels is a dictionary of dictionaries with the following schema for each child dictionary.

Table 17. Schema for blueprint labels Keyname Required Type Description values yes list A list of values for specified key. Each value can be either a string or a call to an intrinsic function, except get_attribute. See Intrinsic Functions.

Examples

This example shows two labels that will be applied to the blueprint:

environment label—Uses a call to the get_input intrinsic function to set one of its values to the input value of owner.

architecture label—Includes two statically defined values.

labels:

environment:

values:

- { get_input: owner }

architecture:

values:

- kubernetes

- containerized
